title: ML: Build Confusion Matrix
story: A confusion matrix breaks down predictions into TP, FP, TN, FN - the foundation for all classification metrics.
instructions: Build a 2x2 confusion matrix manually. y_true=[1,0,1,0,0,1], y_pred=[1,0,0,0,1,1]. Print TP (true positives).
starterCode:
import numpy as np

y_true = np.array([1, 0, 1, 0, 0, 1])
y_pred = np.array([1, 0, 0, 0, 1, 1])

# Calculate confusion matrix components
TP = ((y_true == 1) & (y_pred == 1)).sum()
TN = ((y_true == 0) & (y_pred == 0)).sum()
FP = ((y_true == 0) & (y_pred == 1)).sum()
FN = ((y_true == 1) & (y_pred == 0)).sum()

print(TP)
solutionHidden:
import numpy as np

y_true = np.array([1, 0, 1, 0, 0, 1])
y_pred = np.array([1, 0, 0, 0, 1, 1])

TP = ((y_true == 1) & (y_pred == 1)).sum()
TN = ((y_true == 0) & (y_pred == 0)).sum()
FP = ((y_true == 0) & (y_pred == 1)).sum()
FN = ((y_true == 1) & (y_pred == 0)).sum()

print(TP)

tests.expectedBehavior: Count true positives where both are 1

hints.text: TP: both true and pred are 1. Use & for AND logic.
